1.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
life (as a fleeting portion of time); hence, the world (as transient)

2.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

3.brief: the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice

4.brief: to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
properly, a pithy maxim, usually of metaphorical nature; hence, a simile (as an adage, poem, discourse)
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
a puzzle, hence, a trick, conundrum, sententious maxim

5.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively

6.brief: figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

7.brief: a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve
to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, a cover, i.e. (literally) a village (as covered in); (specifically) bitumen (as used for coating), and the henna plant (as used for dyeing); figuratively, a redemption-price

8.brief: properly, apparently, to be heavy, i.e. (figuratively) valuable; causatively, to make rare (figuratively, to inhibit)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

9.brief: to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction

10.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
properly, foot (as consumed); i.e. (by exten.) of cattle brutishness; (concretely) stupid
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
properly, hinder; generally, next, other, etc.
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength

11.brief: properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
a residence (including a shepherd's hut, the lair of animals, figuratively, the grave; also the Temple); specifically, the Tabernacle (properly, its wooden walls)
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

12.brief: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
value, i.e. (concretely) wealth; abstractly, costliness, dignity
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
to liken, i.e. (transitively) to use figurative language (an allegory, adage, song or the like); intransitively, to resemble
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
to be dumb or silent; hence, to fail or perish; trans. to destroy

13.brief: the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, fatness, i.e. by implication (literally) the loin (as the seat of the leaf fat) or (generally) the viscera; also (figuratively) silliness or (in a good sense) trust
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt

Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
to place, i.e. array; reflex. to lie
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
to tread down, i.e. subjugate; specifically, to crumble off
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
a form (of beauty; as if pressed out, i.e. carved); hence, an (idolatrous) image
to fail; by implication to wear out, decay (causatively, consume, spend)
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
